Monthly Treeverse Update #43

The forty-third edition of monthly Treeverse updates. Read more for game development insights.

Jul 01, 2025
8

Share this post

Endless Clouds Updates
Monthly Treeverse Update #43
3
2
Share

An update on Treeverse. A look at our development and art team progress. We will be posting monthly for you to follow along the development of Treeverse, so make sure you subscribe!

Last monthly update we shared our amazing data from Season 1. And this month was another massive update! $END is coming.

$END is a premium digital trading currency by Endless Clouds Foundation that will be powering Treeverse. Endless Clouds Foundation has raised $6.25M from some of the best angels in the industry consisting of the most talented founders, best traders and huge content creators. See the announcement post here.

You can also view the whitepaper to learn more about what this is and what this means for Treeverse.

$END will be on ETH L1 with a 500M token supply and a bridge to zkEVM. Starting with a 31.1% circulating supply. Majority of the distribution will be dedicated towards the community beginning with a 17.5% airdrop to NFT Snapshot 1 and 2.76% for S1 players on TGE, unvested.

TGE claim is in the next few days, you can view all of these announcements on the EndlessCFDN X and on our Discord.

Weâ€™ve also worked in collaboration with Pluid to create an amazing video detailing the journey of Treeverse so far! Check it out in HD on YouTube.

Art Update

Engineering And Design

Design

Design team has been working on documents for upcoming features as well as adding content for the things that engineers are already done with. Hundreds of new game items have been introduced and added to the game.

Our combat mechanisms are also being refined by our combat designers in his own prototype. Once confirmed on that, they work closely with an engineer to bring across the features as close as possible.

A lot of time has been spent on improving the liveliness of our Lorwick town area with NPCs, animations and more.

Our talent trees has also been setup for the various trees that will be available in Beta. At the moment itâ€™s still just based on spreadsheet data until engineers can implement directly.

Preliminary work has also begun on some further Auxilliary systems such as player profile, storage/bank system and cosmetic system. Engineers will do a first pass using placeholder UI until our UI artist can catch up to the latest version.

We also conducted various types of research on better ways of integrating Timeless in game as well as a reasonable implementation of capes in game, on select upper body equipment.

Engineering

Engineers have been working on the core systems required for our beta release. Since our engineering firepower has increased a fair bit, each engineer gets more time to properly complete and polish features. Weâ€™re definitely noticing much more velocity at the moment. Weâ€™re actively trying to get our core changes and improvements into our designers hands asap so they can implement it in the game. A lot more PRs and code is being pushed through which also means a fair bit more time is spent on code reviews as well.

Talent Tree

  • Quality of life improvements

  • Fixing source generation bugs

AI

  • Adding phase support

  • Huge changes to navigation mesh. Migration to c# instead of using native version.

  • Add support for Patrolling and start working on Monster states.

Questing

  • Support for pure client side quest features

  • Completely reworking of authoring

  • Server side tasks integrated such as starting and saving

  • Added several UX features for designers to have an easier time adding quests.

Combat Changes

  • Adding support for charged abilities

  • Split animation support

  • Moving whilst attacking support

Emotes

  • Core systems implemented for our custom emotes system

  • Reusable animations

  • Adding toolbar support for quickly triggering emotes

Tweens

  • Client side tweening of things that can be triggered by proximity

  • Add editor mode previews of tweens.

Visual Overrides

  • Adjust colour visuals

Architectural Changes

  • Remove dependency on Redis and move to using single database solution instead

    • Migrated startup, heartbeat and Shutdown.

  • Introduce JWT to be used for login instead

Other Stuff

  • Fix camera jittering

  • Remove old engraving code

  • Add debugging tools for skills and unlocking skills

  • Huge amount of time spent on trying to fix builds. Reported some bugs to unity.

  • Tons of PR reviews since many things were merged in.

Going Forward

Our current trajectory and development speed is looking quite promising. Itâ€™s taken a lot of time and effort to get to our current capabilities and these next few months will be vital in solidifying what should be considered the â€œProper Versionâ€ of Treeverse. By this we mean the core mechanics, features and systems will be pretty much set in stone. The team will mostly revolve around the creation of new content and building on top of existing things, with less frequent â€œauxiliaryâ€ features being added at a slower pace.

Our current plan of action is to get the core experience to a really good, polished state, focusing on quality over quantity. We should start seeing the fruits of this labour in the upcoming months, with a good chunk to show for it in our Beta launch.

Disclaimer: Please note that anything written in this document should not be taken as financial advice. Endless Clouds is dedicated to producing a fun, enjoyable game that integrates NFTs. NFTs are a new and highly experimental technology and should not be bought for investment purposes.
